Definition: The code that identifies a country. This code follows the ISO-3166 Alpha-2 coding standard.

Data Element Label: Nature of Action Legal Authority 2 Code
Definition: The law, executive order, rule, regulation, or other basis that, in addition to Legal Authority (1), authorizes the appointing officer to affect a personnel action on an employee. The cited legal authority is the secondary authority relating to the first Nature of Action Code on the Request for Personnel Action or Notification of Personnel Action.

Identification of regional area in association with each level of an agency's organizational structure.  Alignment of regional area to an organizational structure enables the generation of multiple reports for conducting workforce analysis based on regional areas, such as, Central, Midwest, Great Plains, Rocky Mountains, etc., province, or other first administrative district or division of a country or a specific location.
When applicable, the not-to-exceed (NTE) date for certain civilian personnel actions, such as appointments, Leave Without Pay (LWOP), conversions, etc.
Code that represents a required or optional textual remark on a Request for Personnel Action and/or Notification of Personnel Action.
The textual remarks that are required or optional on a Request for Personnel Action and/or Notification of Personnel Action.
Data Example: TOTAL EMPLOYMENT UNDER THIS APPOINTMENT MUST NOT EXCEED (NUMBER) HOURS.

Definition: Date on which the action documented was approved.
A number indicating the order in which a personnel action was processed on a given date.
An individual's email address.
Social security number (SSN), which uniquely identifies the person.

The code that represents the Federal civilian personnel office authorized to appoint and separate an employee, and to the extent such functions have been delegated, prepare personnel actions, maintain official personnel records, and administer programs for staff compensation, training and development, benefits and awards, and employee and labor relations.
The code that identifies the agency and, where applicable, the administrative subdivision (i.e., subelement) in which a person is employed.
The name of the specific organization or division of an agency in which a person is employed.
The name of an organization.
A particular table or array of pay rates prescribed by law or other authoritative source that establishes the basic pay rates for certain employees.
The actual reporting date or ending date of the reporting period for data, records, forms, reports, or other submissions.
Given/chosen/often first name by which a person is known or designated on all official transactions.
Middle name, or initial, by which a person is known or designated on all official transactions.
Inherited, married, or legally chosen name by which a person is known or designated on all official transactions.
Suffix to a full name on all official transactions.
Date on which the person was born.
The effective date of a personnel action.
The code that represents the specific personnel action used to create or change a civilian personnel record.

Data Element Label: Nature of Action Legal Authority 1 Code
Definition: The law, executive order, rule, regulation, or other basis that authorizes the appointing officer to affect a personnel action on an employee. The cited legal authority is the primary authority relating to the first Nature of Action Code on the Request for Personnel Action or Notification of Personnel Action.
Agency specific data field 1.
Title of the individual authorizing the personnel action.

Data Element Label: Position Grade, Level, Rank, or Pay Band Code
Definition: The code that identifies hierarchical relationships among positions covered by the same pay plan or system.

This code represents the specific occupational series that defines the duties and responsibilities of the position. An employee inherits the occupational series assigned to the position they encumber.

Official title prescribed by classification standard, based on occupational series and grade of the position.  When a title is not prescribed, agency establishes title in accordance with classification parameters. Official titles published in classification standards must be used for personnel, budget, and fiscal purposes. Organizational or other titles may be constructed and used for internal administration, public convenience, law enforcement, or similar purposes.
An employee's bargaining unit status.
ServiceFunctionID and Name:
HCM.A8-1 Labor Management Relations Administration
HCM.A1-3 Position Classification & Position Management
HCM.A9-5 Employee Records Recordkeeping
ServiceActivityName:
Labor Management Relations Program Operations
Existing Position
Reclassification or Recertification
New Position Classification
and Certification
Employee Records Capture
Employee Records Maintenance and Use

Definition: Indicates action to take with a data record.
The code that identifies the type of address.
The first line of an address.
The second line of an address.

The name of a city, derived from the two-digit state code in combination with the four-digit (FIPS) Federal Information Processing Standards/American National Standards Institute (ANSI) code uniquely identifies a specific city.
The state name which is derived from the two-digit state Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS)/American National Standards Institute (ANSI) code.
The first five digits of a postal code/zip code.
The last four digits of a postal code/zip code.

A string of specific numbers that a telephone, cell phone user, or computer can dial to reach another telephone, mobile phone, or other telephony device through the public switched telephone network or other private and public networks.
Indicates a person has provided a verified signature on an official record.
The date indicating when a person provided their signature.

The alternative person identifier (other than the primary identifier, the Social Security Number) is a system ID provided by an agency system that uniquely identifies an individual's records. This can be the Employee Identification Number (EIN).
Date indicating when an agency received documentation.
Description of the personnel action(s) requested. These will typically follow the descriptions of the Nature of Action Code(s) requested.
The locally assigned unique identifier for a requested personnel action.
The name pre-fix by which a person is known or designated on all official transactions.
Represents the person type (i.e. Employee, Retiree, Annuitant, Beneficiary, Compensationer, Detailee, Contractor, Non-Employee reporting a safety incident, Witness, etc.).

The Record ID is a unique sequential number (non-negative) that uniquely identifies each record within a batch transmission and used to determine the processing order when multiple records are received within the same batch.
Text field used to provide additional information or document anything unusual or noteworthy.
Indicates the version of the instance document
Indicates the version of the domain values document
In combination with the two digit state code, the four digit (FIPS) Federal Information Processing Standards/American National Standards Institute (ANSI) code uniquely identifies a specific city.

Two digit (FIPS) Federal Information Processing Standards/American National Standards Institute (ANSI) code that uniquely identifies a specific geographic area.  In the U.S. the geographic area defined is a specific state.
A code representing the type of phone number an individual can be reached, i.e., cell phone, home phone, work phone, other.
The name of the agency and, where applicable, the administrative subdivision (i.e., subelement) in which a person is employed.
The number of the time and attendance timekeeper associated with an employee.
ServiceFunctionID and Name:
HCM.A5-2 Work Schedule and Leave Management
HCM.A8-1 Labor Management Relations Administration
ServiceActivityName:
Time Card Management
Labor Management Relations Program Operations

Data Element Label: Labor Organization Dues Deduction Frequency Code
Definition: The code that identifies the frequency of regular dues payments to an employee's labor organization.
ServiceFunctionID and Name:
HCM.A5-1 Compensation Management
HCM.A8-1 Labor Management Relations Administration
ServiceActivityName:
Payroll Processing
Labor Management Relations Program Operations

Data Element Label: Agency Employee and Labor Organization Dues Withholding Eligibility Verification Indicator
Definition: Identifies whether the employee and labor organization meet the requirements for dues withholding.
ServiceFunctionID and Name:
HCM.A5-1 Compensation Management
HCM.A8-1 Labor Management Relations Administration
ServiceActivityName:
Payroll Processing
Labor Management Relations Program Operations

Definition: The date the employee began their appointment.

Data Element Label: Nature of Action Legal Authority 1 Description Text
Definition: The description of the law, executive order, rule, regulation, or other basis that authorizes the appointing officer to effect a personnel action on an employee.
Data Example: Reg 317.305(b).  Conversion to SES from excepted appt.

Data Element Label: Nature of Action Legal Authority 2 Description Text
Definition: The description of the law, executive order, rule, regulation, or other basis that, in addition to LEGAL AUTHORITY (1), authorizes the appointing officer to effect a personnel action on an employee.
Data Example: Reg 317.305(b).  Conversion to SES from excepted appt.

Definition: An alphanumeric code denoting the work assignment location of the employee.
The first line of the textual description of an organization.
The second line of the textual description of an organization.
The third line of the textual description of an organization.
The fourth line of the textual description of an organization.
The fifth line of the textual description of an organization.
The sixth line of the textual description of an organization.
Agency specific data field 2.
Agency specific data field 3.
Agency specific data field 4.
Agency specific data field 5.
The date on which a person completes the necessary paperwork and is sworn in as an employee.
Field used only when required by an agency.
The seventh line of the textual description of an organization.
The eighth line of the textual description of an organization.

Three digit (FIPS) Federal Information Processing Standards/American National Standards Institute (ANSI) code which in combination with the two digit state code uniquely identifies a specific county.  This combination can be used to associate the county in which a specific address is located.

Data Element Label: Nature of Action Agency Extension Code
Definition:
The agency special code that represents the specific personnel action used to create or change a civilian personnel record. 
Agency designated codes 900-999 are reserved for agencies' internal use.
Geographic Locator Code for an employee's work address.
The Transmission Reference ID is a unique sequential number (non-negative integer) that uniquely identifies each transmission.
The code that represents the specific personnel action used to create or change a civilian personnel record.
Contains the form, specification, or document.
Code identifying a specific email in which to contact an individual.
The code representing the form associated with specific remarks.  This field is mapped in conjunction with HCIM 19376 – Remarks/Comments.
The code indicating whether the individual is available by phone number during the day or night.

The name of labor/union organizations that represent employees in addressing concerns  regarding, agency human resource policy, Government rules, regulations, and binding directives affecting conditions of employment.
Text field used to provide additional information or document anything unusual or noteworthy specific to an SSP or Agency.

Data Element Label: Labor Organization Dues Cancellation Reason Code
Definition: The reason deductions for labor organization dues from an employee's check is cancelled.

Data Element Label: Labor Organization Dues Cancellation Effective Date
Definition: The date deductions for labor organization dues are no longer deducted from an employee's salary check.
The begin date of a given fiscal year.
The end date of a given fiscal year.
Identification of a given fiscal year.  Fiscal years typically begin October 1, ending September 30 of a given year. Fiscal Year begin and end dates may vary.

Identification of types of offices in association to each level of an agency's organizational structure.  Alignment of the office type to an organizational structure enables the generation of multiple reports for conducting workforce analysis based on a types of offices, such as, NHQ, State Office, Project Office, Field Office, etc.

Identification of city/county/state in which an office/employees are located in association to each level of an agency's organizational structure.  Alignment of the organizational structure to a official location  enables the generation of multiple reports for conducting workforce analysis based on duty station, such as, Washington, DC; Salina, KS, etc.  This will allow the ability to generate a report of those employees who have a remote duty location (not teleworking) different from the official location designated for the organizational structure.

Identification of types of areas of responsibility in association with each level of an agency's organizational structure.  Alignment of the functional area to an organizational structure enables the generation of multiple reports for conducting workforce analysis based on a functional areas, such as, human resources, public affairs, financial management, etc.  This allows for assessment of all employees who are assigned to a human resources function, who are not classified in the traditional HR occupational series (0201, 0203).
Identification as to the type of agency.

The name of a county, derived from the two digit state code in combination with the three digit county (FIPS) Federal Information Processing Standards/American National Standards Institute (ANSI) code which uniquely identifies a specific county.

Data Element Label: Labor Organization Local/Branch/Lodge Number or Name
Definition: The name of subelements of a labor organization, which may be the Local number, branch name, lodge name, or other appropriate designation.
The proposed effective date of a requested personnel action.
Indicates that agency/supervisor has additional information pertinent to the document or action.
The code representing the status of an employee within an organization (e.g. Active, Retired, Terminated, Inactive).
A code that identifies the type of business transaction that a Fedwire Message represents.
The Transmission Reference ID is a unique sequential number (non-negative integer) that uniquely identifies each transmission.
The Transmission Date Timestamp identifies the date and time the transmission was generated.
Identifies the type of transactions being sent within the batch (only be 1 Batch Type per Batch Number).
Identifies the pay frequency of the records included in the batch.
The Batch Summary Count Number is a required field that provides the total number of 'summary' records submitted in the batch.
The Batch Detail Count Number is a required field that provides the total number of 'detail' records submitted in the batch.
Indicates the type of transmission.
Indicates the element level within a transmission.
Contains a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.
Contains the text of the error code.
Contains the node at which the error occurred.
Contains a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.
Contains the text of the warning code.
Indicates whether the successful result of the inbound document was received or was validated.
